text: Keg at Gainsbourg, Gatineau.  Clear golden, small head. Fruity, lightly grassy nose. Mid sweet with medium body and clean, rounded mouthfeel. Fruity with mild bread and grass. Mid bitter finish. More focus on cool elegance than the down to earth drinkability unusually offered by this style.

En fût au brouepub (Gatineau, QC). Robe blonde, limpide et coiffée dun bon col blanc. Arôme malté/houblonné frais et agrémenté de notes herbacées. Son goût malté/houblonné relativement corsé comporte de nuances de grain et dherbes. Longue finale amère/herbacée. Très bien!

[Draught at the brewpub] Pours a clear light gold with an average size semi-lasting frothy white head. Aroma is grassy along with fresh peas and biscuity malt. Nice flavour of grassy hops, fruit and biscuity malt. Medium bodied. Better then I expected, really good stuff.

On tap at Bières et Saveurs. Aroma: loads of cereals and honey. App: clear pale, minimal white head. Taste and palate: medium body, a tad creamy, smooth, honey in mouth, light bitter finish. Overall: not my favourite but well made. Good job!

My Bottom Line:
Refined pils malt flavors dominate this slender Helles.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A slice of foam covers the clear golden.
-Weyermann Pils malts truly are lovely when clearly evoked like this.
-The mouthfeel could be fluffier or creamier.
-Flavors are authentic and lengthy.
-Hop bitterness could be upped a bit.

On tap at the brewpub.
draft A: herbacy, spicy, light cereal app: clear pale white head t/p: med body short sweet finish o; crisp easy to drink

On tap at the brewery. Light golden with a off white head. Crisp, light profile, light malt profile with some light hops. Light body and moderate carbonation, slightly bitter and dry on the finish. Decent.
Sample at the brew pub. Nice golden hue, great grain and light Munich malt aroma, noble hops, clean. Similar flavor with nice crisp hop bitterness. Lovely stuff.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2014 En fût sur place. Couleur blonde or, claire, mousse blanche. Nez de grains frais avec un petit côté herbal. En bouche, céréales, malt pâle, houblon terreux, finale sèche et qui laisse sétandre une petite amertume. Le malt pilsner est croustillant. Excellente bière de soif, bien construite, qui descend bien.

tap on the premises. clear pale yellow, golden hue, with a small white cap, some retention and lacing. fresh breadied and honeyed maltiness, fat and noble grassy-herbalness, peppery, clean typical german yeast. average to moderate carbonation, light body - oily, dense maltiness, short and balanced peppery-grassy-herbal finish. solid helles. a pleasant surprise.

A golden helles with a thin white head. In aroma, nice biscuit malt with grassy hops, light mineral notes, classic. In mouth, a nice crisp biscuit malt with light grassy German hops, light mineral notes, a summer beer. On tap at brewery.

Pours clear deep gold with a small white ring. Aroma is light bready grain and a small hop presence. Taste is just a no nothing, really well done Helles. Good malt base and a small noble hop bitterness on the back end. Nothing spectacular but easy drinking and enjoyable. Just what a Helles needs to be.
On tap at the brewpub. Clear yellow with a frothy white head. Flavors are honey, grass, cereals, bread and citrus. Light to medium body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture.
